notes.text:
This update for ImageMagick fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2021-20241 [bsc#1182335]: Division by zero in WriteJP2Image() in coders/jp2.c
- CVE-2021-20243 [bsc#1182336]: Division by zero in GetResizeFilterWeight in MagickCore/resize.c
- CVE-2021-20244 [bsc#1182325]: Division by zero in ImplodeImage in MagickCore/visual-effects.c
- CVE-2021-20246 [bsc#1182337]: Division by zero in ScaleResampleFilter in MagickCore/resample.c

This update was imported from the SUSE:SLE-15-SP2:Update update project.
notes.title: Description of the patch

full_product_name.name: ImageMagick-7.0.7.34-lp152.12.12.1.i586 as component of openSUSE Leap 15.2
ImageMagick-7.0.7.34-lp152.12.12.1.x86_64 as component of openSUSE Leap 15.2

notes.text: A flaw was found in ImageMagick in coders/jp2.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of math division by zero. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
